title: How to Avoid the 7 Worst Holiday Table Decor Mistakes
sub_head: Chic decorating ideas from designers and entertaining experts, who identified the Thanksgiving table gaffes they see most often, and what to do instead
body:
FOR MANY AMERICANS, Thanksgiving will mark the first time they are setting the table for a holiday dinner party in quite some time. So we won’t judge when a host positions the dessert fork where the butter knife should be. But some decisions are key to guests’ comfort. A cornucopia that blocks sight lines across the table? A big no. Personal place cards to head off the confusion of seating arrangements? Absolutely. Here, our panel of design and entertaining pros share the mistakes that can derail a holiday dinner party before the turkey even hits the table, plus recommendations for keeping your meal on track and your décor memorable.
A table needn't be covered in brown and orange linens, pilgrim figurines and gourds galore to make the evening feel special. “We are eating the turkey,” said New York interior designer Elizabeth Gill. “We don’t need to see [plates] adorned with turkeys too.”
